# Introduction

Although the primary focus of this package is to get expressions containing
statistical results, one can also use it to extract dataframes containing these
details. This vignette catalogs dataframe outputs from all functions.

A dataframe will typically contain the following columns:

  - *statistic*: the numeric value of a statistic.

  - *parameter*: the numeric value of a parameter being modeled (often degrees
    of freedom for the test); note that if `no.parameters = 0L` (e.g., for
    non-parametric tests), this column will be irrelevant.

  - *parameter1*, *parameter2* relevant only if the statistic in question has
    two degrees of freedom (e.g., anova).

  - *p.value* the two-sided *p*-value associated with the observed statistic.

  - *estimate*: estimated value of the effect size.

  - *conf.low*: lower bound for effect size estimate.

  - *conf.high*: upper bound for effect size estimate.

For details about the tests and types of effect size estimates they correspond
to, see:
<https://indrajeetpatil.github.io/statsExpressions/articles/stats_details.html>

# One-sample tests

```{r}
# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "parametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "nonparametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "robust",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_onesample(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "bayes",
  bf.prior = 0.8,
  output = "dataframe"
)
```

# Two-sample tests

## within-subjects design

```{r}
# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# data
df <- dplyr::filter(bugs_long, condition %in% c("LDLF", "LDHF"))

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  type = "p",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  type = "np",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  type = "r",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  type = "bf",
  output = "dataframe"
)
```

## between-subjects design

```{r}
# setup
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# unequal variance
expr_t_twosample(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "p",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# equal variance
expr_t_twosample(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  var.equal = TRUE,
  type = "p",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "np",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "r",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_t_twosample(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "bf",
  output = "dataframe"
)
```

```{r}
)
```

```{r}
expr_oneway_anova(
```

# Contingency table analyses

```{r}
# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)

# create data structure
paired_data <-
  structure(
    list(
      response_before =
        structure(
          c(1L, 2L, 1L, 2L),
          .Label = c("no", "yes"),
          class = "factor"
        ),
      response_after = structure(
        c(1L, 1L, 2L, 2L),
        .Label = c("no", "yes"),
        class = "factor"
      ),
      Freq = c(65L, 25L, 5L, 5L)
    ),
    class = "data.frame",
    row.names = c(NA, -4L)
  )

# ------------------------ non-Bayesian -----------------------------

# association tests

# unpaired
set.seed(123)
expr_contingency_tab(
  data = mtcars,
  x = am,
  y = cyl,
  paired = FALSE,
  output = "dataframe"
)

# paired
set.seed(123)
expr_contingency_tab(
  data = paired_data,
  x = response_before,
  y = response_after,
  paired = TRUE,
  counts = "Freq",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# goodness-of-fit tests

# with counts
set.seed(123)
expr_contingency_tab(
  data = as.data.frame(HairEyeColor),
  x = Eye,
  counts = Freq,
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ------------------------ Bayesian -----------------------------

# association test
expr_contingency_tab(
  data = mtcars,
  x = am,
  y = cyl,
  paired = FALSE,
  type = "bayes",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# goodness-of-fit test
expr_contingency_tab(
  data = as.data.frame(HairEyeColor),
  x = Eye,
  counts = Freq,
  ratio = c(0.2, 0.2, 0.3, 0.3),
  type = "bayes",
  output = "dataframe"
)
```

# Correlation analyses

```{r}
# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "parametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "nonparametric",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "robust",
  output = "dataframe"
)

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "bayes",
  output = "dataframe"
)
```

# Meta-analysis

```{r}
# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)
library(metaplus)

# renaming to what `statsExpressions` expects
df <- dplyr::rename(mag, estimate = yi, std.error = sei)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_meta_random(data = df, output = "dataframe", type = "parametric")

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_meta_random(data = df, output = "dataframe", type = "robust")

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
expr_meta_random(data = df, output = "dataframe", type = "bayes")
```
